intro: Scorzonera pisidica, commonly known as the Caucasian scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow flowers. The plant produces a tuberous root that is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Scorzonera pisidica thrives in rocky and arid environments, often growing at high altitudes. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
